column2: Choose a patron deity
Although the people of Faerun honour many gods, you may choose to devote yourself to one of them in particular.
Maybe I should choose a deity whose nature and special areas of concern are fitting to my position and governance.
One of the gods of justice and good rulership.
One of the gods of the natural world of Toril.
One of the gods of violence and combat.
A god with a different sort of portfolio...
Maybe I should choose a deity who sponsors an activity which is close to my heart.
One of the gods of light and inspiration.
One of the gods of magic and sorcery.
One of the gods of leisure and happiness.
A god with a different sort of portfolio...
Maybe I should choose a deity who will guide me through the unexpected and difficult parts of life.
One of the gods of chance and good fortune.
One of the gods of darkness and concealment.
A god with a different sort of portfolio...
Choosing a god of justice will show what kind of ruler I mean to be.
Anachtyr, god of justice and lawmaking.
Torm the True, god of loyalty.
Ilmater, the Crying God, patron of those who suffer.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Choosing a god of nature will show my attunement to the world around me.
Nobanion Firemane, lion-spirit of royalty and good animals.
Bhaelros Stormlord, god of natural disasters.
Akadi the Lady of the Winds, primordial of Air.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Choosing a god of conflict will show the strength with which I mean to rule.
Garagos the Reaver, master of all weapons.
Red Knight, mistress of strategy.
Malar the Beastlord, god of the hunt.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Choosing a god of light and inspiration while show the positive nature of my rule.
Lathander the Morninglord, god of dawn, daylight, and renewal.
Selûne the Moonmaiden, goddess of navigation and of the cycles of life.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Dedicating myself to a god of magic will show my respect for the True Art.
Mystra, personification of the Weave, goddess of all magic.
Azuth, god of wizards and spellcraft.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Worshipping a god of leisure and happiness will show that I mean to be a bountiful ruler.
Lliira Joybringer, goddess of happiness and dance.
Sharess, goddess of sexuality and sensual pleasure.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Honouring a deity of chance and good fortune will show that I wish good things for my people.
Tymora, goddess of good luck.
Waukeen, goddess of commerce and prosperity.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Worshipping a god of darkness and concealment will show my subjects that they should rely on me for protection in this harsh world.
Shar Nightsinger, goddess of secrets and forgetting.
Ibrandul, Lord of the Dry Depths, god of caverns and stealth.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Dedicated to Akadi
Dedicated to Anachtyr
Dedicated to Bhaelros
Dedicated to Garagos
Dedicated to Ibrandul
Dedicated to Malar
Dedicated to Nobanion
Dedicated to Shar
